clinical_study.brief_title: (NAVIGATOR) Study of BLU-285 in Patients With Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumors (GIST) and Other Relapsed and Refractory Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Study of BLU-285 in Patients With Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumors (GIST) and Other Relapsed and Refractory Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 1, open-label, first-in-human (FIH) study designed to evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics (PK), pharmacodynamics (PD) and antineoplastic activity of avapritinib (formerly BLU-285), administered orally (PO), in adult patients with unresectable GIST or other relapsed or refractory solid tumors. The study consists of 2 parts, a dose-escalation part (Part 1) and an expansion part (Part 2).

primary_outcome.measure: Part 1: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) and Recommended Phase 2 Dose (RP2D) of Avapritinib
primary_outcome.description: Patients with event(s) of dose-limiting toxicity

primary_outcome.measure: Parts 1 and 2: Number of Patients With Adverse Events (AE) and Serious Adverse Events (SAE)
primary_outcome.time_frame: AEs were collected from the start of study drug until 30 days after the last dose, SAEs were collected from the date of the informed consent signature until 30 days after the last dose of study drug, up to 5 years
primary_outcome.description: The overall safety profile of the drug was assessed by reviewing the number of patients with AEs, SAEs and other events. There was no formal statistical analysis. Safety assessments continued for the duration of treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Part 2: Objective Response Rate (ORR) Determined by Central Radiology Assessment Per mRECIST, Version 1.1
primary_outcome.time_frame: Tumor assessments were performed at screening, Cycle 3 Day 1, then every 2 cycles through Cycle 13, then every 3 cycles thereafter up to approximately 4 years. Each cycle is 28 days.
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate objective response rate (ORR) determined by central radiology assessment per mRECIST, version 1.1 in patients with advanced GIST treated with avapritinib. A complete response per modified Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.1) is defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions. A partial response is defined as at least 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum of diameters. Overall Response (OR) = CR + PR

secondary_outcome.description: Maximum plasma drug concentration (Cmax) following a single dose of avapritinib

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Maximum Plasma Drug Concentration (Tmax)
secondary_outcome.description: Cycle 1 Day 1 PK time to maximum plasma drug concentration (Tmax)

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Drug Concentration at 24 Hours Postdose Prior to the Next Daily Dose (C24)
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma drug concentration at 24 hours postdose prior to the next daily dose (C24) following a single dose of avapritinib

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time 0 to 24 Hours (AUC 0-24)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time 0 to 24 hours (AUC 0-24) following a single dose of avapritinib

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent Oral Clearance Unadjusted for Bioavailability (CL/F)
secondary_outcome.description: Apparent oral clearance unadjusted for bioavailability (CL/F) following a single dose of avapritinib

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent Volume of Distribution, Unadjusted for Bioavailability (Vz/F)
secondary_outcome.description: Apparent volume of distribution, unadjusted for bioavailability (Vz/F) following a single dose of avapritinib
Terminal elimination half-life (t1/2) following a single dose of avapritinib

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Plasma Drug Concentration (Cmax) at Steady State
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum plasma drug concentration (Cmax) at steady state following 15 days of QD dosing

secondary_outcome.measure: Time of Maximal Concentration (Tmax) at Steady State
secondary_outcome.description: Time of maximal concentration (Tmax) at steady state following 15 days of QD dosing

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Drug Concentration at 24 Hours Postdose Prior to the Next Daily Dose at Steady State (C24,ss)
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma Drug Concentration at 24 Hours Postdose Prior to the Next Daily Dose at steady state (C24,ss) following 15 days of QD dosing

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve Over the Dosing Interval at Steady Sate (AUC0-τ,ss) (τ=24 h)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve over the dosing interval at steady sate (AUC0-τ,ss) (τ=24 h) following 15 days of QD dosing

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Tumor assessments were performed at screening, Cycle 3 Day 1, then every 2 cycles through Cycle 13, then every 3 cycles thereafter up to approximately 4 years. Each cycle is 28 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival is defined as the time in months from the start of treatment to the date of first documented progression or death due to any cause. Progression-free survival determined by central radiological assessment per modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (mRECIST), version 1.1 in patients with advanced GIST. A progressively growing tumor must meet the following criteria: a) the target lesions must be greater or equal to 2cm in size and be a new GIST active lesion or b) the target lesions must be expanding on at least 2 sequential imaging studies.

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent Oral Clearance at Steady State, Unadjusted for Bioavailability (CLss/F)
secondary_outcome.description: Apparent oral clearance at steady state, unadjusted for bioavailability (CLss/F) following 15 days of QD dosing

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Benefit Rate Determined by Central Radiology Assessment Per mRECIST, Version 1.1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Tumor assessments were performed at screening, Cycle 3 Day 1, then every 2 cycles through Cycle 13, then every 3 cycles thereafter up to approximately 4 years. Each cycle is 28 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Percent of patients with a complete response, partial response or stable disease lasting more than 16 weeks. A complete response per modified Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.1) is defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions. A partial response is defined as at least 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum of diameters. Stable disease is defined as a tumor that does not meet the criteria for progression or for response. A progressively growing tumor must meet the following criteria: a) the target lesions must be greater or equal to 2cm in size and be a new GIST active lesion or b) the target lesions must be expanding on at least 2 sequential imaging studies.

secondary_outcome.measure: Response Rate Determined by Central Radiology Assessment Per Choi Criteria
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Tumor assessments were performed at screening, Cycle 3 Day 1, then every 2 cycles through Cycle 13, then every 3 cycles thereafter up to approximately 4 years. Each cycle is 28 days.
secondary_outcome.description: A complete response is defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions. A partial response is ≥10% decrease tumor size at computed tomography (CT) or ≥15% decrease in tumor attenuation at computed tomography (CT) and no new lesions. The response rate is defined as complete response plus partial response.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Response Determined by Central Radiology Assessment Per mRECIST, Version 1.1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Tumor assessments were performed at screening, Cycle 3 Day 1, then every 2 cycles through Cycle 13, then every 3 cycles thereafter up to approximately 4 years. Each cycle is 28 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Duration from time to first documented CR/PR to date of first documented disease progression or death. A complete response per modified Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.1) is defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions. A partial response is defined as at least 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum of diameters. Overall Response (OR) = CR + PR

secondary_outcome.measure: Median PFS on Last Prior Anti-cancer Therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Historical data collected at enrollment, all available data on prior therapy was collected
secondary_outcome.description: Progression Free Survival (PFS) is defined as the time in months from the start of treatment to the date of first documented disease progression or death due to any cause, which ever occurs first. PFS on last prior anti-cancer therapy is defined as the time in months from the start of last prior anti-cancer therapy to progression on that therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Levels of KIT and PDGFRα Mutant Allele Fractions in Peripheral Blood
secondary_outcome.description: Change of mutant allele fraction (MAF) summarizes the largest fold change. Change from baseline only displayed for patients with pre and post treatment MAF measurements. A positive number represents an increase in MAF. Data is only provided for patients that had both a baseline measurement and an end of treatment measurement.

secondary_outcome.measure: KIT, PDGFRA, and Other Cancer-relevant Mutations Present in Tumor Tissue at Baseline and EOT
secondary_outcome.description: Change in mutations in tumor tissue at baseline and end of treatment (EOT). EOT tumor biopsies were optional and there were no EOT samples collected.

clinical_study.condition: Other Relapsed or Refractory Solid Tumors

arm_group.description: Part 1: Patients received a starting dose of 30 mg QD for 28 days and they were assessed for dose limiting toxicities (DLT). If no DTLs were observed the dose escalation continued. Patients received avapritinib in continuous 28 day cycles until discontinuation.

Part 1: Patients received a starting dose of 60 mg QD for 28 days and they were assessed for dose limiting toxicities (DLT). If no DTLs were observed the dose escalation continued. Patients received avapritinib in continuous 28 day cycles until discontinuation.

Part 1: Patients received a starting dose of 90 mg QD for 28 days and they were assessed for dose limiting toxicities (DLT). If no DTLs were observed the dose escalation continued. Patients received avapritinib in continuous 28 day cycles until discontinuation.

Part 1: Patients received a starting dose of 135 mg QD for 28 days and they were assessed for dose limiting toxicities (DLT). If no DTLs were observed the dose escalation continued. Patients received avapritinib in continuous 28 day cycles until discontinuation.

Part 1: Patients received a starting dose of 200 mg QD for 28 days and they were assessed for dose limiting toxicities (DLT). If no DTLs were observed the dose escalation continued. Patients received avapritinib in continuous 28 day cycles until discontinuation. .

Part 1: Patients received a starting dose of 300 mg QD for 28 days and they were assessed for dose limiting toxicities (DLT). If no DTLs were observed the dose escalation continued. Patients received avapritinib in continuous 28 day cycles until discontinuation. Patients that received at least one dose of avapritinib were included in the Part 2 analysis.

Part 1: Patients received a starting dose of 400 mg QD for 28 days and they were assessed for dose limiting toxicities (DLT). If no DTLs were observed the dose escalation continued. Patients received avapritinib in continuous 28 day cycles until discontinuation. Patients that received at least one dose of avapritinib were included in the Part 2 analysis.

Part 1: Patients received a starting dose of 600 mg QD for 28 days and they were assessed for dose limiting toxicities (DLT). If no DTLs were observed the dose escalation continued. Patients received avapritinib in continuous 28 day cycles until discontinuation.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Part 1 and Part 2 Avapritinib (formerly BLU-285) 300 mg or 400 mg QD
arm_group.description: Part 1 and Part 2: Patients enrolled in Part 1 and Part 2 at a starting dose of 300 or 400 mg QD were included in the Part1/Part 2 safety and efficacy analysis. Patients received avapritinib in continuous 28 day cycles until discontinuation.

intervention.arm_group_label: Part 1 and Part 2 Avapritinib (formerly BLU-285) 300 mg or 400 mg QD

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- For Part 1: Histologically- or cytologically-confirmed diagnosis of unresectable GIST or another advanced solid tumor. Patients with unresectable GIST must have disease that has progressed following imatinib and at least 1 of the following: sunitinib, regorafenib, sorafenib, dasatinib, pazopanib or an experimental kinase-inhibitor agent, or disease with a D842 mutation in the PDGFRα gene. Patients with an advanced solid tumor other than GIST must have relapsed or refractory disease without an available effective therapy.
OR For Part 2:
- Group 1: Patients must have a confirmed diagnosis of unresectable GIST that has progressed following imatinib and at least 1 of the following: sunitinib, regorafenib, sorafenib, dasatinib, pazopanib, or an experimental kinase-inhibitor agent, and the patient does not have a D842V mutation in PDGFRα.
- Group 2: Patients must have a confirmed diagnosis of unresectable GIST with a D842V mutation in the PDGFRα gene. The PDGFRα mutation will be identified by local or central assessment, either in an archival tissue sample or a new tumor biopsy obtained prior to treatment with avapritinib.
- Group 3: Patients must have a confirmed diagnosis of unresectable GIST that has progressed and/or patients must have experienced intolerance to imatinib and not received additional kinase-inhibitor therapy. Patients must not have a known D842V mutation in PDGFRα.
- Groups 1, 2 and 3: At least 1 measurable lesion defined by mRECIST 1.1 for patients with GIST.
- Groups 1 and 2: A tumor sample (archival tissue or a new tumor biopsy) has been submitted for mutational testing.
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0-2
Exclusion Criteria:
- QT interval corrected using Fridericia's formula (QTcF) >450 milliseconds
- Platelet count <90,000/mL
- Absolute neutrophil count <1000/mL
- Hemoglobin <9 g/dL
- Aspartate aminotransferase (AST) or alanine aminotransferase (ALT) >3 x the upper limit of normal (ULN) if no hepatic metastases are present; >5 × ULN if hepatic metastases are present
- Total bilirubin >1.5 × ULN; >3 × ULN with direct bilirubin, >1.5 × ULN in the presence of Gilbert's Disease
- Estimated (Cockroft-Gault formula) or measured creatinine clearance <40 mL/min Brain malignancy or metastases to the brain
- History of a seizure disorder or requirement for anti-seizure medication
- Group 3: Patients known to be KIT wild type.

facility.name: Leuven Cancer Institute University Hospitals Leuven
Fondazione IRCCS - Istituto Nazinale dei Tumori
Centrum Onkologii-Instytut im. Marii Skłodowskiej-Curie w Warszawie
Vall d' Hebron Institute of Oncology (VHIO)

measure.title: Parts 1 and 2: Number of Patients With Adverse Events (AE) and Serious Adverse Events (SAE)
measure.description: The overall safety profile of the drug was assessed by reviewing the number of patients with AEs, SAEs and other events. There was no formal statistical analysis. Safety assessments continued for the duration of treatment.
measure.population: Safety Population - all patients that received at least one dose of avapritinib

class.title: Participants with a Serious Adverse Event

outcome.title: Part 2: Objective Response Rate (ORR) Determined by Central Radiology Assessment Per mRECIST, Version 1.1
outcome.description: To evaluate objective response rate (ORR) determined by central radiology assessment per mRECIST, version 1.1 in patients with advanced GIST treated with avapritinib. A complete response per modified Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.1) is defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions. A partial response is defined as at least 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum of diameters. Overall Response (OR) = CR + PR
outcome.time_frame: Tumor assessments were performed at screening, Cycle 3 Day 1, then every 2 cycles through Cycle 13, then every 3 cycles thereafter up to approximately 4 years. Each cycle is 28 days.
outcome.population: patients enrolled in Part 1 or Part 2 with a starting dose of 300 or 400 mg, including 13 patients enrolled in Part 1

group.title: Patients With a PDGFRA D842V Mutation
group.description: Patients with a PDGFRA D842V Mutation, any line of treatment

group.title: 2L Patients Without a PDGFRA D842V Mutation
group.description: Patients that do not have a PDGFRA D842V mutation and have received 1 prior line of therapy

group.title: 3L Patients Without a PDGFRA D842V Mutation
group.description: Patients that do not have a PDGFRA D842V mutation and have had 2 or more prior lines of therapy

measure.title: Part 2: Objective Response Rate (ORR) Determined by Central Radiology Assessment Per mRECIST, Version 1.1
measure.description: To evaluate objective response rate (ORR) determined by central radiology assessment per mRECIST, version 1.1 in patients with advanced GIST treated with avapritinib. A complete response per modified Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.1) is defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions. A partial response is defined as at least 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum of diameters. Overall Response (OR) = CR + PR
measure.population: patients enrolled in Part 1 or Part 2 with a starting dose of 300 or 400 mg, including 13 patients enrolled in Part 1

outcome.population: Patients enrolled in Part 1 and Part 2 with a starting dose of 300 or 400 mg QD and available samples for PK

outcome.title: Progression-free Survival Per mRECIST Version 1.1
outcome.description: Progression-free survival is defined as the time in months from the start of treatment to the date of first documented progression or death due to any cause. Progression-free survival determined by central radiological assessment per modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (mRECIST), version 1.1 in patients with advanced GIST. A progressively growing tumor must meet the following criteria: a) the target lesions must be greater or equal to 2cm in size and be a new GIST active lesion or b) the target lesions must be expanding on at least 2 sequential imaging studies.
outcome.time_frame: Tumor assessments were performed at screening, Cycle 3 Day 1, then every 2 cycles through Cycle 13, then every 3 cycles thereafter up to approximately 4 years. Each cycle is 28 days.
outcome.population: Patients enrolled in Part 1 or Part 2 with a starting dose of 300 or 400 mg QD

group.title: Patients With a PDGFRA D842V Mutation
group.description: Patients with a PDGFRA D842V mutation, any line of treatment

group.title: 2L Patients Without a PDGFRA D842V Mutation

group.title: 3L Patients Without a PDGFRA D842V Mutation
group.description: Patients that do not have a PDGFRA D842V mutation and have had 2 or more prior lines of therapy

measure.title: Progression-free Survival Per mRECIST Version 1.1
measure.description: Progression-free survival is defined as the time in months from the start of treatment to the date of first documented progression or death due to any cause. Progression-free survival determined by central radiological assessment per modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (mRECIST), version 1.1 in patients with advanced GIST. A progressively growing tumor must meet the following criteria: a) the target lesions must be greater or equal to 2cm in size and be a new GIST active lesion or b) the target lesions must be expanding on at least 2 sequential imaging studies.
measure.population: Patients enrolled in Part 1 or Part 2 with a starting dose of 300 or 400 mg QD

measure.population: Patients enrolled in Part 1 and Part 2 with a starting dose of 300 or 400 mg QD and available samples for PK

outcome.title: Clinical Benefit Rate Determined by Central Radiology Assessment Per mRECIST, Version 1.1
outcome.description: Percent of patients with a complete response, partial response or stable disease lasting more than 16 weeks. A complete response per modified Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.1) is defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions. A partial response is defined as at least 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum of diameters. Stable disease is defined as a tumor that does not meet the criteria for progression or for response. A progressively growing tumor must meet the following criteria: a) the target lesions must be greater or equal to 2cm in size and be a new GIST active lesion or b) the target lesions must be expanding on at least 2 sequential imaging studies.
outcome.time_frame: Tumor assessments were performed at screening, Cycle 3 Day 1, then every 2 cycles through Cycle 13, then every 3 cycles thereafter up to approximately 4 years. Each cycle is 28 days.
outcome.population: patients with a starting dose of 300 or 400 mg QD

group.title: Patients With a PDGFRA D842V Mutation
group.description: Patients with a PDGFRA D842V mutation, any line of treatment

group.title: 2L Patients Without a PDGFRA D842V Mutation
group.description: Patients that do not have a PDGFRA D842V mutation and have received 1 prior line of therapy

group.title: 3L Patients Without a PDGFRA D842V Mutation
group.description: Patients that do not have a PDGFRA D842V mutation and have had 2 or more prior lines of therapy

measure.title: Clinical Benefit Rate Determined by Central Radiology Assessment Per mRECIST, Version 1.1
measure.description: Percent of patients with a complete response, partial response or stable disease lasting more than 16 weeks. A complete response per modified Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.1) is defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions. A partial response is defined as at least 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum of diameters. Stable disease is defined as a tumor that does not meet the criteria for progression or for response. A progressively growing tumor must meet the following criteria: a) the target lesions must be greater or equal to 2cm in size and be a new GIST active lesion or b) the target lesions must be expanding on at least 2 sequential imaging studies.
measure.population: patients with a starting dose of 300 or 400 mg QD

outcome.title: Response Rate Determined by Central Radiology Assessment Per Choi Criteria
outcome.description: A complete response is defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions. A partial response is ≥10% decrease tumor size at computed tomography (CT) or ≥15% decrease in tumor attenuation at computed tomography (CT) and no new lesions. The response rate is defined as complete response plus partial response.
outcome.time_frame: Tumor assessments were performed at screening, Cycle 3 Day 1, then every 2 cycles through Cycle 13, then every 3 cycles thereafter up to approximately 4 years. Each cycle is 28 days.
outcome.population: Patients enrolled in Part 1 or Part 2 with a starting dose of 300 or 400 mg

group.title: Patients With a PDGFRA D842V Mutation
group.description: Patients with a PDGFRA D842V mutation, any line of treatment

group.title: 2L Patients Without a PDGFRA D842V Mutation
group.description: Patients that do not have a PDGFRA D842V mutation and have received 1 prior line of therapy

group.title: 3L Patients Without a PDGFRA D842V Mutation
group.description: Patients that do not have a PDGFRA D842V mutation and have had 2 or more prior lines of therapy

measure.title: Response Rate Determined by Central Radiology Assessment Per Choi Criteria
measure.description: A complete response is defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions. A partial response is ≥10% decrease tumor size at computed tomography (CT) or ≥15% decrease in tumor attenuation at computed tomography (CT) and no new lesions. The response rate is defined as complete response plus partial response.
measure.population: Patients enrolled in Part 1 or Part 2 with a starting dose of 300 or 400 mg

outcome.title: Duration of Response Determined by Central Radiology Assessment Per mRECIST, Version 1.1
outcome.description: Duration from time to first documented CR/PR to date of first documented disease progression or death. A complete response per modified Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.1) is defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions. A partial response is defined as at least 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum of diameters. Overall Response (OR) = CR + PR
outcome.time_frame: Tumor assessments were performed at screening, Cycle 3 Day 1, then every 2 cycles through Cycle 13, then every 3 cycles thereafter up to approximately 4 years. Each cycle is 28 days.
outcome.population: Patients in Part 1 and Part 2 with a starting dose of 300 or 400 mg QD. Only patients that achieved a CR or PR are included in this analysis

group.title: Patients With PDGFRA D842V Mutation
group.description: Patients with a PDGFRA D842V mutation, any line of treatment

group.title: 2L Patients Without a PDGFRA D842V Mutation
group.description: Patients that do not have a PDGFRA D842V mutation and have received 1 prior line of therapy

group.title: 3L Patients Without a PDGFRA D842V Mutation
group.description: Patients that do not have a PDGFRA D842V mutation and have had 2 or more prior lines of therapy

measure.title: Duration of Response Determined by Central Radiology Assessment Per mRECIST, Version 1.1
measure.description: Duration from time to first documented CR/PR to date of first documented disease progression or death. A complete response per modified Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.1) is defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions. A partial response is defined as at least 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions taking as reference the baseline sum of diameters. Overall Response (OR) = CR + PR
measure.population: Patients in Part 1 and Part 2 with a starting dose of 300 or 400 mg QD. Only patients that achieved a CR or PR are included in this analysis

measurement_list.measurement: The upper bounds of the confidence interval could not be calculated

outcome.title: Median PFS on Last Prior Anti-cancer Therapy
outcome.description: Progression Free Survival (PFS) is defined as the time in months from the start of treatment to the date of first documented disease progression or death due to any cause, which ever occurs first. PFS on last prior anti-cancer therapy is defined as the time in months from the start of last prior anti-cancer therapy to progression on that therapy.
outcome.time_frame: Historical data collected at enrollment, all available data on prior therapy was collected
outcome.population: Patients enrolled on any dose (Part 1 and Part 2) with data on progression-free survival for the most recent prior therapy

group.title: Patients With a PDGFRA D842V Mutation
group.description: Patients with a PDGFRA D842V mutation, any line of treatment

group.description: Patients that do not have a PDGFRA D842V mutation and have had 2 or more prior lines of therapy

measure.title: Median PFS on Last Prior Anti-cancer Therapy
measure.description: Progression Free Survival (PFS) is defined as the time in months from the start of treatment to the date of first documented disease progression or death due to any cause, which ever occurs first. PFS on last prior anti-cancer therapy is defined as the time in months from the start of last prior anti-cancer therapy to progression on that therapy.
measure.population: Patients enrolled on any dose (Part 1 and Part 2) with data on progression-free survival for the most recent prior therapy

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Levels of KIT and PDGFRα Mutant Allele Fractions in Peripheral Blood
outcome.description: Change of mutant allele fraction (MAF) summarizes the largest fold change. Change from baseline only displayed for patients with pre and post treatment MAF measurements. A positive number represents an increase in MAF. Data is only provided for patients that had both a baseline measurement and an end of treatment measurement.
outcome.population: Patients enrolled in Part 1 or Part 2 with a starting dose of 300 or 400 mg QD

group.title: Experimental: Part 1 and Part 2 Avapritinib (Formerly BLU-285) 300 mg or 400 mg QD
group.description: Part 1 and Part 2: Patients enrolled in Part 1 and Part 2 at a starting dose of 300 or 400 mg QD were included in the Part1/Part 2 safety and efficacy analysis. Patients received avapritinib in continuous 28 day cycles until discontinuation.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Levels of KIT and PDGFRα Mutant Allele Fractions in Peripheral Blood
measure.description: Change of mutant allele fraction (MAF) summarizes the largest fold change. Change from baseline only displayed for patients with pre and post treatment MAF measurements. A positive number represents an increase in MAF. Data is only provided for patients that had both a baseline measurement and an end of treatment measurement.
measure.population: Patients enrolled in Part 1 or Part 2 with a starting dose of 300 or 400 mg QD

outcome.title: KIT, PDGFRA, and Other Cancer-relevant Mutations Present in Tumor Tissue at Baseline and EOT
outcome.description: Change in mutations in tumor tissue at baseline and end of treatment (EOT). EOT tumor biopsies were optional and there were no EOT samples collected.
outcome.population: Patients with pre-and post-treatment tumor biopsies. No patients provided a post-treatment biopsy.

reported_events.time_frame: For each patient adverse event data were collected starting at the time of the first dose of study drug until 30 days after the final dose of study drug. Serious adverse event data were collected from the time the informed consent was signed until 30 days after the final dose of study drug. On average 8 months, up to 5 years.

group.title: Experimental: Part 1 Avapritinib (Formerly BLU-285) 30 mg QD
group.description: Part 1: Patients received a starting dose of 30 mg QD for 28 days and they were assessed for dose limiting toxicities (DLT). If no DTLs were observed the dose escalation continued. Patients received avapritinib in continuous 28 day cycles until discontinuation.

group.description: Part 1: Patients received a starting dose of 200 mg QD for 28 days and they were assessed for dose limiting toxicities (DLT). If no DTLs were observed the dose escalation continued. Patients received avapritinib in continuous 28 day cycles until discontinuation.

group.description: Part 1: Patients received a starting dose of 600 mg QD for 28 days and they were assessed for dose limiting toxicities (DLT). If no DTLs were observed the dose escalation continued. Patients received avapritinib in continuous 28 day cycles until discontinuation.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
